description: Variation of Condition 8 (Use Class) submitted pursuant of planning permission 00600/E/P17 dated 13/11/2018 for retention, refurbishment and extension of existing undesignated heritage asset fronting Heston Road to contain a replacement community use at ground and basement level (Use Class D1) with four flats above and to the rear (two one-bedroom and two two-bedroom) together with a new building at the rear containing five flats (three two-bedroom and two-three bedroom) with 12 parking spaces and communal amenity space.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of application reference 00600/E/P17 dated 13 November 2018.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: (HRH/P18/01; HRH/P18/02; HRH/P18/03; HRH/P18/05; HRH/P18/06; HRH/P17/07; HRH/P18/08; HRH/P18/09; HRH/P18/10; HRH/P18/11; HRH/P17/20; HRH/P18/21; Flood Risk Statement; Arboricultural Impact and Method Statement; Archaeological Desk Based Assessment; Built Heritage Statement; Built Heritage Addendum; Sustainability and Energy Statement; Transport Statement; Planning Design and Access Statement; Received 19/09/2018; HRH/P18/04 Rev B; Received 12/11/2018. Covering letter dated 20 October 2023. Received: 09 November 2023)

Condition : 3 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9:00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 4 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details of materials under application 00600/E/P17(4i-13) dated 14 July 2021.
Condition : 5 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details of hard and soft landscaping under application 00600/E/P17(4i-13) dated 14 July 2021.

Condition : 6 - In this condition ""retained tree"" means an existing tree which is to be retained in accordance with the approved plans and particulars; and paragraphs (a) and (b) below shall have effect until the expiration of (5 years) from (the date of the occupation of the building for its permitted use). (a) No retained tree shall be cut down, uprooted or destroyed, nor shall any retained tree be topped or lopped other than in accordance with the approved plans and particulars, without the written approval of the local planning authority. Any topping or lopping approved shall be carried out in accordance with British Standard[3998 (Tree Work)] or any other BS replacing. (b) If any retained tree is removed, uprooted or destroyed or dies, another tree shall be planted at the same place and that tree shall be of such size and species, and shall be planted at such time, as may be specified in writing by the local planning authority. (c) The erection of fencing for the protection of any retained tree shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved plans and particulars before any equipment, machinery or materials are brought on to the site for the purposes of the development, and shall be maintained until all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site. Nothing shall be stored or placed in any area fenced in accordance with this condition and the ground levels within those areas shall not be altered, nor shall any excavation be made, without the written consent of the local planning authority.

Condition : 7 - The waste and recycled materials storage arrangements shown on the approved drawing shall be completed before any part of the accommodation hereby permitted is occupied and retained during the lifetime of this development.

Condition : 8 - The commercial premises shall only be used for purposes within the following sub categories of Use Class E (commercial, business & service): a. For the display or retail sale of goods, other than hot food, principally to visiting members of the public; c. For the provision of the following kinds of services principally to visiting members of the public: i. Financial services, ii. Professional services (other than health or medical services), or iii. Any other services which it is appropriate to provide in a commercial, business or service locality; e. For the provision of medical or health services, principally to visiting members of the public, except the use of premises attached to the residence of the consultant or practitioner; g.(i) an office to carry out any operational or administrative functions.
And for no other purposes (including any other purpose in Class E of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification).

Condition : 9 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Construction Logistics Plan approved under application 00600/E/P17(4i-13) dated 14 July 2021. The details as approved shall be adhered to throughout the course of construction.
Condition : 10 - The car parking areas shall be managed in compliance with the Car Park Management Plan approved under application 00600/E/P17(4i-13) dated 14 July 2021.

Condition : 11 - Before the building/use hereby permitted is first occupied, an area shall be laid out and surfaced within the site in accordance with approved drawings/details for the turning, loading and unloading of vehicles, and for 12 cars to be parked. This area shall be permanently retained thereafter, in accordance with approved drawings/details, and shall not be used for any other purpose at any time.

Condition : 12 - Prior to the occupation of the building hereby approved on the site the cycle parking facilities in line with the approved drawings shall be installed and retained during the lifetime of this development.

Condition : 13 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the energy strategy and evidence details approved under application 00600/E/P17(4i-13) dated 14 July 2021 and application 00600/E/P17(13-17) dated 22 November 2022.

Condition : 14 - The residential part of the development shall be constructed to achieve an internal water consumption not exceeding 105 litres/person/day in line with The Water Efficiency Calculator for new dwellings issued by the Ministry for Housing, Communities and Local Government.
Condition : 15 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the sustainable sourcing of materials details approved under application 00600/E/P17(13-17) dated 22 November 2022.
Condition : 16 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the detailed drainage designs approved under application 00600/E/P17(16) dated 09 February 2022.

Condition : 17 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the drainage evidence details approved under application 00600/E/P17(13-17) dated 22 November 2022. The drainage features will be managed as per the approved maintenance plan for the lifetime of the development.

Condition : 18 - Before the commercial use hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a Delivery & Servicing Plan (including details of vehicle access and egress arrangements and times that servicing shall take place) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall accord with current guidance such as that issued by TfL and include measures required to ensure sufficient arrangements (physical as well as managerial) for the servicing, including refuse collection, of all aspects of the development, the timing of hours for deliveries by motor vehicles and a timetable for implementation. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to any variation.
Condition : 19 - The commercial use hereby permitted shall not be operated outside of the following hours: 7am to 11pm Monday to Saturday and 8am to 10pm Sundays and Public Holidays.
